title: What are the best HBS (Harvard Business School) case studies? - Quora

response.answer_text: My favorites so far from the past two years across all the courses I have taken include: Marketing Optical Distortion  Warner Brothers Entertainment  Hulu   Entrepreneurship Zipcar: Refining the Business Model  OfficeTiger   Strategy Dogfight over Europe: Ryanair  Apple  Wal-mart  The Economist  Walt Disney Company and Pixar, Inc: To Acquire or Not to Acquire?   Leadership and Human Capital Management Erik Peterson  Donna Dubinsky and Apple Computer  Cirque du Soleil  Friendly Fire   Technology and Operations Management National Cranberry Cooperative  Barilla SpA  Zara: IT for Fast Fashion   Business and Government The Octopus and the Generals: The United Fruit Company in Guatemala  Rupert Murdoch: The Last Tycoon I will add details about the key learnings/takeaways from each with a little more time.

Every year an individual organization rates the case studies from different schools. This organisation, The Case Centre is an non profit that has more than 8000 case writers registered with it. According to the official website of The Case Centre: The Case Centre is the independent home of the case method. We are dedicated to advancing the case method worldwide, sharing knowledge, wisdom and experience to inspire and transform business education across the globe. We are a not-for-profit organisation and registered charity. However, in the Top 40 Case Studies list that it came out with, it has named these case studies by current and former Harvard Business School faculty members as some of the best.
